newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA -AGRICULTURAL BANK SAYS TO RETAIN 1996 PROFITS.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA -AGRICULTURAL BANK SAYS TO RETAIN 1996 PROFITS.

text.p: Lithuania's state-run Agricultural Bank, which is slated for privatisation, said on Friday that its shareholders had decided to keep all of the profits in the company and not to pay dividends.
The bank reported last week that its 1996 net profit had fallen to 25.5 million litas from 26.5 million litas the previous year.
But the bank said it has financial difficulties stemming from soft credits granted in previous years to the country's struggling agricultural sector.

"The bank's shareholders have decided that they will not pay dividends for 1996 and will use the 1996 profits to compensate for losses from previous years," the bank's spokeswoman, Imandre Daukshiene, told Reuters.
She added that the shareholders had rejected a proposal to boost the bank's share capital by 29.25 million litas to 157.25 million litas.
The bank, the largest in the country in terms of assets, is one of two state-run banks which the government has committed itself to privatise through open bids.
